member.name: T:CSVideoPlayer.RendererOptions
member.summary: Provides access to various internal media renderer options.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.RendererOptions.AudioDisableSync
member.summary: By default, the audio renderer will skip or wait for samples to synchronize to video.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.RendererOptions.DirectSoundDevice
member.summary: Gets or sets the DirectSound device identifier. It is the default playback device by default. Only valid if is set to false which is the default.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.RendererOptions.LegacyAudioDevice
member.summary: Gets or sets the wave device identifier. -1 is the default playback device. Only valid if is set to true.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.RendererOptions.UseLegacyAudioOut
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the legacy MME (WinMM) should be used as an audio output device as opposed to DirectSound. This defaults to false.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.RendererOptions.VideoRefreshRateLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the frame refresh rate limit for the video renderer. Defaults to 0 and means no limit. Units are in frames per second.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.Library.EnableWpfMultiThreadedVideo
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the video visualization control creates its own dispatcher thread to handle rendering of video frames. This is an experimental feature and it is useful when creating video walls. For example if you want to display multiple videos at a time and don't want to use time from the main UI thread. This feature is only valid if we are in a WPF context.

member.name: E:CSVideoPlayer.cMediaPlayer.MediaOpening

member.name: E:CSVideoPlayer.cMediaPlayer.MediaChanging
member.summary: Raised before a change in media options is applied. Use this method to modify the selected streams.
member.remarks: This event is raised on a background thread. All interaction with UI elements requires calls on their corresponding dispatcher.

member.name: E:CSVideoPlayer.cMediaPlayer.PacketRead
member.summary: Raised when a packet is read from the input stream. Useful for capturing streams. This event is not raised on the UI thread and the pointers in the event arguments are only valid for the call. If you need to keep a queue you will need to clone and release the allocated memory yourself by using clone and release methods in the native FFmpeg API.

member.name: E:CSVideoPlayer.cMediaPlayer.AudioFrameDecoded
member.summary: Raised when an audio frame is decoded from input stream. Useful for capturing streams. This event is not raised on the UI thread and the pointers in the event arguments are only valid for the call. If you need to keep a queue you will need to clone and release the allocated memory yourself by using clone and release methods in the native FFmpeg API.

member.name: E:CSVideoPlayer.cMediaPlayer.VideoFrameDecoded
member.summary: Raised when a video frame is decoded from input stream. Useful for capturing streams. This event is not raised on the UI thread and the pointers in the event arguments are only valid for the call. If you need to keep a queue you will need to clone and release the allocated memory yourself by using clone and release methods in the native FFmpeg API.

member.name: E:CSVideoPlayer.cMediaPlayer.SubtitleDecoded
member.summary: Raised when a subtitle is decoded from input stream. Useful for capturing streams. This event is not raised on the UI thread and the pointers in the event arguments are only valid for the call. If you need to keep a queue you will need to clone and release the allocated memory yourself by using clone and release methods in the native FFmpeg API.

member.name: E:CSVideoPlayer.cMediaPlayer.RenderingSubtitles
member.summary: Occurs right before the subtitles are rendered. You can update the text. Ensure you handle this quickly before you get choppy subtitles.

The default behavior is that it is under manual control (i.e. the caller should call methods such as Play in order to play the media). member.summary: Settings as defined in SoundTouch.h.

member.name: F:CSVideoPlayer.SoundTouch.Setting.UseAntiAliasFilter
member.summary: Enable/disable anti-alias filter in pitch transposer (0 = disable)

member.name: F:CSVideoPlayer.SoundTouch.Setting.AntiAliasFilterLength
member.summary: Pitch transposer anti-alias filter length (8 .. 128 taps, default = 32)

member.name: F:CSVideoPlayer.SoundTouch.Setting.UseQuickSeek
member.summary: Enable/disable quick seeking algorithm in tempo changer routine (enabling quick seeking lowers CPU utilization but causes a minor sound quality compromising)

member.name: F:CSVideoPlayer.SoundTouch.Setting.SequenceMilliseconds
member.summary: Time-stretch algorithm single processing sequence length in milliseconds. This determines to how long sequences the original sound is chopped in the time-stretch algorithm. See "STTypes.h" or README for more information.

member.name: F:CSVideoPlayer.SoundTouch.Setting.SeekWindowMilliseconds
member.summary: Time-stretch algorithm seeking window length in milliseconds for algorithm that finds the best possible overlapping location. This determines from how wide window the algorithm may look for an optimal joining location when mixing the sound sequences back together. See "STTypes.h" or README for more information.

member.name: F:CSVideoPlayer.SoundTouch.Setting.OverlapMilliseconds
member.summary: Time-stretch algorithm overlap length in milliseconds. When the chopped sound sequences are mixed back together, to form a continuous sound stream, this parameter defines over how long period the two consecutive sequences are let to overlap each other. See "STTypes.h" or README for more information.

member.name: F:CSVideoPlayer.SoundTouch.Setting.NominalInputSequence
member.summary:
Call "getSetting" with this ID to query processing sequence size in samples. This value gives approximate value of how many input samples you'll need to feed into SoundTouch after initial buffering to get out a new batch of output samples.
This value does not include initial buffering at beginning of a new processing stream, use SETTING_INITIAL_LATENCY to get the initial buffering size.
Notices: - This is read-only parameter, i.e. setSetting ignores this parameter - This parameter value is not constant but change depending on tempo/pitch/rate/sample rate settings.

member.name: F:CSVideoPlayer.SoundTouch.Setting.NominalOutputSequence
member.summary:
Call "getSetting" with this ID to query nominal average processing output size in samples. This value tells approximate value how many output samples SoundTouch outputs once it does DSP processing run for a batch of input samples.
Notices: - This is read-only parameter, i.e. setSetting ignores this parameter - This parameter value is not constant but change depending on tempo/pitch/rate/sample rate settings.

member.name: F:CSVideoPlayer.SoundTouch.Setting.InitialLatency
member.summary:
Call "getSetting" with this ID to query initial processing latency, i.e. approx. how many samples you'll need to enter to SoundTouch pipeline before you can expect to get first batch of ready output samples out.
After the first output batch, you can then expect to get approx. SETTING_NOMINAL_OUTPUT_SEQUENCE ready samples out for every SETTING_NOMINAL_INPUT_SEQUENCE samples that you enter into SoundTouch.
Example: processing with parameter -tempo=5 => initial latency = 5509 samples input sequence = 4167 samples output sequence = 3969 samples
Accordingly, you can expect to feed in approx. 5509 samples at beginning of the stream, and then you'll get out the first 3969 samples. After that, for every approx. 4167 samples that you'll put in, you'll receive again approx. 3969 samples out.
This also means that average latency during stream processing is INITIAL_LATENCY-OUTPUT_SEQUENCE/2, in the above example case 5509-3969/2 = 3524 samples
Notices: - This is read-only parameter, i.e. setSetting ignores this parameter - This parameter value is not constant but change depending on tempo/pitch/rate/sample rate settings.

M:CSVideoPlayer.SoundTouch.Flush
member.summary: Flushes the last samples from the processing pipeline to the output. Clears also the internal processing buffers. Note: This function is meant for extracting the last samples of a sound stream. This function may introduce additional blank samples in the end of the sound stream, and thus it's not recommended to call this function in the middle of a sound stream.

member.summary: Adds 'numSamples' pcs of samples from the 'samples' memory position into the input of the object. Notice that sample rate _has_to_ be set before calling this function, otherwise throws a runtime_error exception.
member.param: Number of sample frames in buffer. Notice that in case of multi-channel sound a single sample frame contains data for all channels.

member.name: M:CSVideoPlayer.DirectSoundPlayer.ClearBackBuffer
member.summary: Clean up the SecondaryBuffer.

remarks.para: In DirectSound, when playback is started, the rest of the sound that was played last time is played back as noise. This happens even if the secondary buffer is completely silenced, so it seems that the buffer in the primary buffer or higher is not cleared.
To solve this problem fill the secondary buffer with silence data when stop playback.

member.name: T:CSVideoPlayer.DirectSoundPlayer.DirectSound.EnumerateDevicesDelegate
member.summary: The DSEnumCallback function is an application-defined callback function that enumerates the DirectSound drivers. The system calls this function in response to the application's call to the DirectSoundEnumerate or DirectSoundCaptureEnumerate function.
member.param: Address of the GUID that identifies the device being enumerated, or NULL for the primary device. This value can be passed to the DirectSoundCreate8 or DirectSoundCaptureCreate8 function to create a device object for that driver.
Address of a null-terminated string that provides a textual description of the DirectSound device.
Address of a null-terminated string that specifies the module name of the DirectSound driver corresponding to this device.
Address of application-defined data. This is the pointer passed to DirectSoundEnumerate or DirectSoundCaptureEnumerate as the lpContext parameter.
member.returns: Returns TRUE to continue enumerating drivers, or FALSE to stop.

member.name: T:CSVideoPlayer.CommandManager
member.summary: Provides the MediEngine with an API to execute media control commands. Direct Commands execute immediately (Open, CLose, Change) Priority Commands execute in the queue but before anything else and are exclusive (Play, Pause, Stop) Seek commands are queued and replaced. These are processed in a deferred manner by this worker.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets the media engine state.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.CommandManager.PendingPriorityCommand
member.summary: Gets the pending priority command. There can only be one at a time.

member.name: M:CSVideoPlayer.CommandManager.OpenMediaAsync(System.Uri)
member.summary: Opens the media using a standard URI.
member.returns: An awaitable task which contains a boolean whether or not to resume media when completed.

member.name: M:CSVideoPlayer.CommandManager.OpenMediaAsync(CSVideoPlayer.IMediaInputStream)
member.summary: Opens the media using a custom stream.
member.returns: An awaitable task which contains a boolean whether or not to resume media when completed.

member.name: M:CSVideoPlayer.CommandManager.CloseMediaAsync
member.summary: Closes the currently open media.
member.returns: An awaitable task which contains a boolean whether or not to resume media when completed.

member.name: M:CSVideoPlayer.CommandManager.ChangeMediaAsync
member.summary: Changes the media components and applies new configuration.
member.returns: An awaitable task which contains a boolean whether or not to resume media when completed.

member.name: M:CSVideoPlayer.CommandManager.PlayMediaAsync
member.summary: Plays the currently open media.
member.returns: An awaitable task which contains a boolean result. True means success. False means failure.

member.name: M:CSVideoPlayer.CommandManager.PauseMediaAsync
member.summary: Pauses the currently open media asynchronous.
member.returns: An awaitable task which contains a boolean result. True means success. False means failure.

member.name: M:CSVideoPlayer.CommandManager.StopMediaAsync
member.summary: Stops the currently open media. This seeks to the start of the input and pauses the clock.
member.returns: An awaitable task which contains a boolean result. True means success. False means failure.

member.name: M:CSVideoPlayer.CommandManager.SeekMediaAsync(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Queues a seek operation.

member.summary: Port of avioflags direct.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.DemuxerGlobalOptions.ProbeSize
member.summary: Set probing size in bytes, i.e. the size of the data to analyze to get stream information. A higher value will enable detecting more information in case it is dispersed into the stream, but will increase latency. Must be an integer not lesser than 32. It is 5000000 by default.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.DemuxerGlobalOptions.PacketSize
member.summary: Set packet size.

member.summary: Ignore index. Port of ffflags.

member.summary: Enable fast, but inaccurate seeks for some formats. Port of ffflags.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.DemuxerGlobalOptions.FlagGeneratePts
member.summary: Generate PTS. Port of genpts.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.DemuxerGlobalOptions.FlagEnableNoFillIn
member.summary: Do not fill in missing values that can be exactly calculated. Port of ffflags.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.DemuxerGlobalOptions.FlagIgnoreDts
member.summary: Ignore DTS. Port of ffflags.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.DemuxerGlobalOptions.FlagDiscardCorrupt
member.summary: Discard corrupted frames. Port of ffflags.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.DemuxerGlobalOptions.FlagSortDts
member.summary: Try to interleave output packets by DTS. Port of ffflags.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.DemuxerGlobalOptions.FlagKeepSideData
member.summary: Do not merge side data. Port of ffflags.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.DemuxerGlobalOptions.FlagEnableLatmPayload
member.summary: Enable RTP MP4A-LATM payload. Port of ffflags.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.DemuxerGlobalOptions.FlagNoBuffer
member.summary: Reduce the latency introduced by optional buffering Port of ffflags.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.DemuxerGlobalOptions.FlagStopAtShortest
member.summary: Stop muxing at the end of the shortest stream. It may be needed to increase max_interleave_delta to avoid flushing the longer streams before EOF. Port of ffflags.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.DemuxerGlobalOptions.SeekToAny
member.summary: Allow seeking to non-keyframes on demuxer level when supported if set to 1. Default is 0.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.DemuxerGlobalOptions.MaxAnalyzeDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum duration to be analyzed before identifying stream information. In realtime streams this can be reduced to reduce latency (i.e. TimeSpan.Zero).

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.DemuxerGlobalOptions.CryptoKey
member.summary: Set decryption key. A hexadecimal string without the prefixes (0x) or suffixes (h) needs to be provided.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.DemuxerGlobalOptions.ProtocolWhitelist
member.summary: Gets or sets the protocol whitelist. The values must be separated by comma. Example: file,http,https,tcp,tls.

member.summary: Initially contains the best suitable audio stream. Can be changed to a different stream reference.

member.summary: Gets or sets the subtitles URL. If set, the subtitles will be side-loaded and the loaded media subtitles (if any) will be ignored.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.MediaOptions.VideoBlockCache
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of video blocks to cache in the decoder. Leave as -1 for auto. Please note that increasing the amount of blocks, significantly increases RAM usage.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.MediaOptions.AudioBlockCache
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of audio blocks to cache in the decoder. Leave as -1 for auto. Please note that increasing the amount of blocks, significantly increases RAM usage.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.MediaOptions.SubtitleBlockCache
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of audio blocks to cache in the decoder. Leave as -1 for auto. Please note that increasing the amount of blocks, significantly increases RAM usage.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.MediaOptions.IsTimeSyncDisabled
member.summary: Only recommended for live streams. Gets or sets a value indicating whether each component needs to run its timing independently. This property is useful when for example when the audio and the video components of the stream have no timing relationship or when you don't need the components to be synchronized between them.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.MediaOptions.MinimumPlaybackBufferPercent
member.summary: Typically, and especially for live streams, you want to wait for some packet data to become available before resuming playback. The buffer percent represents 1 second of data for each component -- excluding subtitles. Valid range is from 0.0 (do not wait for packet data) to 1.0 (wait for 1 second on each component. This defaults to 0.5 which is suitable for most live streams.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.MediaOptions.UseParallelDecoding
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether component frames are decoded in parallel. This defaults to false but it is enabled automatically when is enabled.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.MediaOptions.UseParallelRendering
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether component blocks are sent to their corresponding renderers in parallel. This defaults to false.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.MediaOptions.IsFluidSeekingDisabled
member.summary: When seeking, the default behavior is to render video frames as soon as they become available and thus creating an effect of fluidity when quickly seeking through the media stream. You can disable this effect and frames will not be rendered until the seek operation completes.

member.name: T:CSVideoPlayer.MediaBlock
member.summary: A base class for blocks of the different MediaTypes. Blocks are the result of decoding and scaling a frame. Blocks have pre-allocated buffers which makes them memory and CPU efficient. Reuse blocks as much as possible. Once you create a block from a frame, you don't need the frame anymore so make sure you dispose the frame.

member.name: M:CSVideoPlayer.MediaBlockBuffer.IndexOf(System.Int64)
member.summary: Retrieves the index of the playback block corresponding to the specified render time. This uses very fast binary and linear search combinations. member.summary:
Converts decoded, raw frame data in the frame source into a a usable frame.
The process includes performing picture, samples or text conversions so that the decoded source frame data is easily usable in multimedia applications.
member.param: The source frame to use as an input.
The target frame that will be updated with the source frame. If null is passed the frame will be instantiated.
The previous block from which to derive information in case the current frame contains invalid data.
member.returns: Returns true of the operation succeeded. False otherwise.

member.name: T:CSVideoPlayer.MediaContainer
member.summary: A container capable of opening an input url, reading packets from it, decoding frames, seeking, and pausing and resuming network streams Code based on https://raw.githubusercontent.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/release/3.2/ffplay.c The method pipeline should be: 1. Set Options (or don't, for automatic options) and Initialize, 2. Perform continuous packet reads, 3. Perform continuous frame decodes 4. Perform continuous block materialization.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.MediaContainer.StateRequiresPictureAttachments
member.summary: Picture attachments are required when video streams support them and these attached packets must be read before reading the first frame of the stream and after seeking. This property is not part of the public API and is meant more for internal purposes.

member.name: M:CSVideoPlayer.MediaContainer.Initialize
member.summary: Initializes the container and its input context, extracting stream information. Container configuration passed on the constructor is applied. This method must be called to make the container usable.

member.name: M:CSVideoPlayer.MediaContainer.Open
member.summary: Opens the individual stream components on the existing input context in order to start reading packets. Any Media Options must be set before this method is called.

member.name: M:CSVideoPlayer.MediaContainer.Seek(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Seeks to the specified position in the main stream component. Returns the keyframe on or before the specified position. Most of the times you will need to keep reading packets and receiving frames to reach the exact position. Pass TimeSpan.MinValue to seek to the beginning of the stream.
member.exception: No input context initialized.

member.name: M:CSVideoPlayer.MediaContainer.Read
member.summary: Reads the next available packet, sending the packet to the corresponding internal media component. It also sets IsAtEndOfStream property. Returns the media type if the packet was accepted by any of the media components. Returns None if the packet was not accepted by any of the media components or if reading failed (i.e. End of stream already or read error). Packets are queued internally. To dequeue them you need to call the receive frames method of each component until the packet buffer count becomes 0.
member.returns: The media type of the packet that was read.
member.exception: No input context initialized.
When a read error occurs.

member.name: M:CSVideoPlayer.MediaContainer.Decode
member.summary: Decodes the next available packet in the packet queue for each of the components. Returns the list of decoded frames. The list of 0 or more decoded frames is returned in ascending StartTime order. A Packet may contain 0 or more frames. Once the frame source objects are returned, you are responsible for calling the Dispose method on them to free the underlying FFmpeg frame. Note that even after releasing them you can still use the managed properties. If you intend on Converting the frames to usable media frames (with Convert) you must not release the frame. Specify the release input argument as true and the frame will be automatically freed from memory.

member.name: M:CSVideoPlayer.MediaContainer.Convert(CSVideoPlayer.MediaFrame,CSVideoPlayer.MediaBlock@,System.Boolean,CSVideoPlayer.MediaBlock)
member.summary: Performs audio, video and subtitle conversions on the decoded input frame so data can be used as a Frame. Please note that if the output is passed as a reference. This works as follows: if the output reference is null it will be automatically instantiated and returned by this function. This enables to either instantiate or reuse a previously allocated Frame. This is important because buffer allocations are expensive operations and this allows you to perform the allocation once and continue reusing the same buffer.
member.param: The raw frame source. Has to be compatible with the target. (e.g. use VideoFrameSource to convert to VideoFrame).
The target frame. Has to be compatible with the source.
if set to true releases the raw frame source from unmanaged memory.
The previous block from which to extract timing information in case it is missing.
member.exception: No input context initialized.
MediaType.
input.
input or input.

member.name: P:CSVideoPlayer.MediaEngine.IsSyncBuffering
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the decoder worker is sync-buffering. Sync-buffering is entered when there are no main blocks for the current clock. This in turn pauses the clock (without changing the media state). The decoder exits this condition when buffering is no longer needed and updates the clock position to what is available in the main block buffer.
